dialogues.text: Victor!     I need your help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked him first!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My problem's bigger! Toshiaki points to the distance - a towering, giant Turtle is walking past. Its a suburban Gamera. Sparky barks defensively. Bob has to admit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    He's right. A beat. Victor has to think fast. This is all his fault. He looks down at Sparky and gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok let's go! Victor, Sparky and Bob rush off. Toshiaki starts to laugh and reveals his video recorder. He is secretly quite pleased with his science project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgemeister and Elsa are still on stage as the crowd look on applauding. Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2     59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now for our next act we have something really big. Suddenly, SCREAMS in the crowd. The audience turns and sees THE GIANT TURTLE - marching through town, crushing everything in its path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked gasp) Burgemeister flees, leaving Elsa to her own devices. He rushes through to the back of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running franticly, Burgemeister tries to save himself. He nearly crashes into the Gym Teacher, busy fleeing the Wererat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Gasp*

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Screams* No get away. Desperate for a place to hide, Burgemeister spots a porta potty and quickly ducks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgemeister can hear the pandemonium escalating but, feeling safe for the moment, sits on the toilet and breathes a sigh of relief. Strangely he feels something sharp poke him in the butt. When he jumps up he sees a host of sea monkeys, jumping out of the toilet! The door to the porta-potty bursts open and Mr Burgemeister is trampled, as the sea monkeys head towards the center of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym teacher races past some destructed stalls being chased by a Wererat. She swiftly climbs up a pole were the Wererat can not follow her. The sea monkeys are everywhere. They even emerge from a man hole and chase Bob's Mom through the stalls. Victor's Mom and Dad try to battle off the approaching sea monkeys but there are too many of them. Mom grabs Dad by the arm and pulls him into a nearby phone booth. Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2   60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way! In here. They slam the door just as a sea monkey flies into it and slides down the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Suddenly another sea monkey smashes into the glass followed by another and then another. Mom and Dad are surrounded. Just as it appears they are going to be overwhelmed - THE TURTLE MONSTER arrives. His huge hand bears down on the phone box ripping it from the ground. Mom and Dad make their move and run to find safety as the turtle monster chomps down on the phone box and the sea monkeys scurry off.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE OF THE SQUARE
dialogues.text: Victor, Toshiaki and Bob arrive at the town square. They see the turtle monster in the centre of town. There are Sea Monkeys everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nassor, drunk with power, commands the Mummy Hamster to take on the turtle monster and show him who is mightier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go Colossus! Kill! Kill! Kill! Kill! The Mummy Hamster gets ready to attack, when, in one large step, the Turtle Monster's giant foot lands directly on the Mummy Hamster and squashes him flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collosus? The angry turtle roars in Nassor's face knocking him clear across the square. Nassor flies with such velocity that he gets tangled up in the banners and bunting that festoon the street and he lands in an upright display of Russian nesting dolls. As he smashes into the case we see that now he too is wrapped up like a mummy. His scowling eyes are all that is visible as the lid closes like a sarcophagus and collapses to the ground. Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2   61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E flees the sea monkeys and runs straight into the Wererat who is still howling at the foot of the gym teacher's pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Get away from me! Get away from me! Ah! The Wererat immediately turns his attentions to E and chases him past a beer stall were the sea monkeys continue to cause havoc at a beer stall, spilling beer everywhere. One of the sea monkeys grabs a carton of pop corn and devours it in one bite. No sooner has he swallowed, when he begins to fizz and expand and suddenly explodes - splattering goop everywhere. Victor and Bob are watching from behind a stall and Victor gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sea monkeys, were they freshwater or saltwater? Bob knows this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freshwater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freshwater animals can't tolerate salt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor empties a sack of pop corn kernels into a pop corn machine in the pop corn tent. Bob adds the salt. Victor turns the machine on. The boys try and lure the sea monkeys into the tent by waving popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey over here! The sea monkeys follow them and start to gorge themselves on the freshly made popcorn. Victor, Bob and Sparky zip up the tent and stand by the beer stall to see what happens. Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2   62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sea monkeys greedily consume the popcorn with feverish abandon and the boys watch in amazement as the tent stretches and grows. The canvas sides stretch and strain from the pressure. Victor and Sparky duck behind a nearby keg just as tent suddenly explodes splashing pop corn (and sea monkey parts) all over the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool! Bob haughtily celebrates a little too quickly and gets completely drenched in pop corn goop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *screams* Victor and Sparky look over to see that ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa, Persephone and E are being attacked by the Wererat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Elsa is using a stick to fight him off but the stick breaks in half and the Wererat seems ready to pounce. E is no help at all and takes this moment to for his life leaving Elsa and Persephone completely helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! Stay away from us! Victor and Sparky come running to the rescue. Sparky leaps in front of Elsa and takes on the Wererat himself. They battle ferociously, Sparky can holding his own against the much bigger Wererat. Then in the scuffle, the Wererat bites down on Sparky's neck but instead of landing a fatal blow, he bites into the bolts on Sparky's neck and gets a ZAP of electricity. The Wererat instantly collapses down to a normal size rat and lands in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky! Victor races over to make sure Sparky is not hurt and suddenly they hear an almighty roar - Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2   63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turtle monster is drawn to the lights on the ferris wheel. The broken beer barrels continue to flow and the square beneath his massive feet is almost flooded. Toshiaki has climbed into one of the ferris wheel carriages and has been filming the chaos from high above the square. He laughs maniacally at the power of his creation when he suddenly finds himself face to face with the monster himself. The Turtle roars with anger and Toshiaki starts to panic. He tries to climb out of the carriage and avoid the Turtle's sharp teeth but it is too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaah! The turtle monster grabs Toshiaki by the pants and lifts him up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no! Stop you put me down- I gave you life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toshiaki dangles from the monster's jaws as the turtle steps back smashing an electrical fuse box with his tail. Sparks fly everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor! Victor I need help please. Victor sees the wires from the fuse box hissing and sparking near the puddle of beer and gets an idea. He remembers from his science class that water conducts electricity and the turtle monster is still standing in the center of the flooded square. Victor grabs the wire and throws it into the puddle sending sparks and current up the Turtle's leg. The impact of the jolt causes the turtle monster to drop Toshiaki who smashes into a tulip stall. Undeterred, Toshiaki continues to try and film the proceedings but he is too late. Just as he puts the camera to his eye, the turtle explodes and all that is left is reduced to a tiny shell which falls to the ground at Toshiaki's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solemnly) Shelley. Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2    64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa comforts Persephone after their ordeal with the Wererat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Persephone, are you ok? Sparky runs over to join them and make sure that Persephone is ok when they hear the Weird Girl calling out for her cat. She stands at the base of a souvenir stall beckoning to the Vampire cat who completely ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here Mr Whiskers! Here kitty kitty Mr Whiskers. THE VAMPIRE CAT swoops right past her. With a blood curdling screech, he grabs Persephone and flies off towards the windmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Elsa races after her dog, dropping her hat and wig in her haste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peresphone! Help! Bring her back. Victor hears Elsa's screams and goes after her. The Weird Girl is still dazed and confused, still calling for her kitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Whiskers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming Elsa! Sparky tries to keep up, but his legs are too stubby. PANTING, he grabs Elsa's wig and turns back in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that the mayhem seems to have ended, the townsfolk start to assemble to review the damage. Since the power lines went out, they carry lit torches Burgemeister pulls himself out of the wreckage and dusts himself off. All around him are remnants of his beloved dutch day; broken tulips and decimated wooden shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2    65 He can't take much more devastation when - Sparky runs past with Elsa's wig in his mouth. Sparky sees Mom and Dad and drops Elsa's wig at their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky! There you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? Sparky barks at Mom and Dad. Doing his best Lassie, he tries to explain what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got there boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me through! Burgemeister pushes his way through the crowd    that has gathered around Sparky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it! It's the boys dead dog! Sparky steps back to show Burgemeister Elsa's wig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Elsa's wig! Where's my niece!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's killed the little girl! The crowd has clearly misunderstood. Desperate, Sparky runs, hoping they will follow. Burgemeister leads the crowd in a chase up to the windmill. Still wearing their costumes from Dutch day and carrying torches, they look like a mob of medieval villagers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After him kill the monster! Mom and Dad follow close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor arrives at the windmill and rushes inside. Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2   66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can hear Elsa's scream coming from the rafters and he looks up at the winding, rickety stair that leads to the crows nest. The vampire cat is creeping towards Elsa pushing her further and further up the windmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Stay away from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky leads the way towards the windmill with the angry mob trailing close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky arrives at the base of the windmill and tries to make them understand that Elsa and Victor are inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him! Burgemeister signals to one of the villagers to throw a rope around Sparky's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my niece? In his   hysterical zeal Burgemeister waves his torch around   and inadvertently sets the windmill overhang on fire.    The sails are quickly engulfed in flames but the blades   keep turning. The crowd gasps in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out it's on fire! Sparky continues to bark and pull on the leash, trying desperately to make them understand. Bob's Mom sees something at the top of the windmill and points to Elsa who has climbed out onto the hub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Elsa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2   67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor continues to climb the stairs trying to get to Elsa as quickly as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa and Persephone have now backed all the way to the edge of the hub and when the vampire cat swoops past them, they lose their balance. Elsa grasps onto a sail but she can barely hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa! The crowd recoils in horror and Sparky breaks free and runs into the burning windmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor arrives at the top level of the windmill.    Smoke and flames are rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs out the window towards Elsa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on don't let go Victor holds his hand out trying to get hold of Elsa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't reach. The vampire cat lunges towards Victor and is about to finish him off when Sparky appears through the window and launches an attack. He chases the Vampire cat up the sails leaving Victor to reach again for Elsa and Persephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hold on much longer! Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2    68 Victor turns to look around and grabs a rope and throws it over the side just as Elsa loses her grip. Just in the nick of time, she catches the rope and swings to safety. Burgemeister breaks her fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaah! Whoah!!! Seeing that Elsa has landed safely, Victor looks up to see the Vampire Cat and Sparky fighting on the end of the sail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky! The Cat tries to knock him off but Sparky scampers out of the way and slides safely down the sail into Victor arms. The Vampire Cat is undeterred and he makes one final lunge towards them, knocking Victor off the side. The crowd gasps in horror as Victor and the Vampire cat plummet through the floor boards and disappear into the bowels of the burning windmill. Mom and Dad try to run forward but are held back by a fireman. The flames are too high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back it's too dangerous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my son in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky battles the flames and races to the bottom on the windmill to find the Vampire Cat and Victor lying unconscious on the floor. Grabbing Victor by the collar, Sparky uses all his strength to drag Victor out of the Windmill to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and Dad see Sparky and Victor appearing out of the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor! Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2       69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey are you alright? The crowd cheers and Victor and his parents share a relieved embrace. Sparky barks with joy and is about to run to join Victor and his parents when the vampire cat rears up from out of the flames and drags Sparky back into the collapsing windmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back inside, The vampire cat and Sparky fight to the death. The flames have almost completely enveloped the windmill and shards of burning debris falls all around them. The vampire cat knocks Sparky backwards and corners him against the wall. He bares his fangs and moves in for the kill. Sparky steels himself for the worst as a flaming shard of wood breaks off the rafters and plummets to the ground, impaling the cat through the heart. Sparky is saved and tries to run for the door when     -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windmill finally collapses. A CLOUD of SPARKS and CINDERS. The crowd jumps back to safety and through the smoke, Victor shouts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun hasn't quite risen.    Thanks to the FIREMEN, the blaze is out. Victor wipes away tears, smudged with soot.   His Mom hug his shoulders. A FIREFIGHTER emerges from the debris carrying Sparky's body. The little dog is singed, but still in one piece. The firefighter lays him on the dirt. Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2   70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor kneels over the lifeless body of his amazing dog. In the crowd... Dad kneels beside his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor? Is there anything we can do for you? Victor looks up at his Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that I need to let him go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes adults don't know what they're talking about. Victor smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the cars are in a circle around Sparky, their headlights blazing. As we CIRCLE, townsfolk lift the hoods of the cars and attach jumper cables, which all feed in to two main lines. Victor attaches cables to Sparky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start your engines. The townspeople rev their engines but it doesn't seem to be working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it more juice! Sparky's body sparks with electricity and Victor looks hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off your engines! Dad waves for everyone to cut their engines.   Now it's just headlights. Victor approaches his dog but Sparky still isn't moving. He kneels down and places his hand on his back. He looks at his tail but all is still. He quietly leans in and - Final Shooting Script_2012_01_18_v2    71 Almost in a WHISPER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, boy. You don't have to come back. You'll always be in my heart. Victor takes the clips off Sparky and walks away back to his Mom and Dad. They hold him for a long beat, when we notice Sparky's tail THUMP THUMP THUMPING. Sparky opens an eye.   Then sits up like he's woken from good long sleep. Victor turns as Sparky gets up and runs towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky! The crowd CHEERS and APPLAUDS. Victor hugs his dog, so happy to be reunited. Victor's Mom and Dad make their way over to him. Sparky does a few tricks for the crowd, then notices someone pushing through the crowd. Persephone, white streaked hair glistening in the moonlight, comes bounding out to see him and they share a playful moment before - The two dogs share a sniff.   And a jolt.
